Articles.Content:
I'm trying to make spaceplane textures, but for some reason they appear very pixelated when zooming out. What's wrong?

Not bad when up close:

![p8fZTfr.png](http://i.imgur.com/p8fZTfr.png)

Very pixelated in distance:

![ETFqj8a.png](http://i.imgur.com/ETFqj8a.png)

I'm not using normals for the exterior.

Here's my texture without the specular mask:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/29v9al46ciz0fvp/SPR_hangar.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/29v9al46ciz0fvp/SPR_hangar.png?dl=0)

I'm using OPT spaceplane textures for reference (spaceship body in the middle), here's one of those:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/nac8rcououyqupy/texture_jk_7m_adaptor.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/nac8rcououyqupy/texture_jk_7m_adaptor.png?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-03T06:11:27Z" title="04/03/2015 06:11  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 3, 2015</time> by Enceos**
Try using TGA textures (parttools can convert them when you export). PNGs don't have mipmaps which would prevent that.

Bingo )

TGAs in business:

![wBGDla6.png](http://i.imgur.com/wBGDla6.png)

Textures are WIP though.
Please use MBM for all textures, [for these reasons](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62776).
Also try to keep lines on whole pixels, DXT conversion is really fond of making a blocky mess of them otherwise...

> 
> Please use MBM for all textures, [for these reasons](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62776).

I'll use DDS when I'm done. It has all good the good sides of .png, .tga and .mbm altogether. It's just a source image was my problem, cause .dds copies problems.
Enceos: The game converts textures to DDS during runtime anyway (MBM is literally "convert to DDS, then convert to raw again...then convert to DDS again when the game loads") so...

> 
> Enceos: The game converts textures to DDS during runtime anyway (MBM is literally "convert to DDS, then convert to raw again...then convert to DDS again when the game loads") so...

As long as I know 1.0 will support DDS textures natively.
